page.title: 18St. Marys Church Brixton
page.content: In 1086 the Christian worship of Brixton was conducted by monks from Plympton Abbey. The people probably worshipped around the village cross. After 1121 there was probably a small chapel on the site of the present church. Our present church was dedicated in 1477. It is perpendicular in style. It has a nave, two aisles, chancel and sanctuary. The tower is 18 metres high and has six bells. There are many stained glass windows in the church depicting biblical scenes. There is a fine wood carved pulpit and limestone font. There has been 30 vicars since 1181. The present vicar is the Revd. Dennis Maddocks. He may be the last vicar of Brixton because the parish may become a team ministry with Yealmpton.
